alert.note: Alert for Golden Valley; Judith Gap; Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Southern Wheatland; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 14 at 1:11AM MST until January 15 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills of 35 to 50 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills of 20 to 40 below zero expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Montana. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 11 AM this morning to 11 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of light snow will accumulate to less than an inch late this afternoon to early Monday. Expect areas of reduced visibility.
info.instruction: People are urged to stay indoors until conditions improve. If you must go outside, dress in layers. Several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Cover exposed skin to reduce your risk of frostbite or hypothermia. Gloves, a scarf, and a hat will keep you from losing your body heat. Keep pets indoors as much as possible.

area.areaDesc: Golden Valley; Judith Gap; Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Southern Wheatland; Southwestern Yellowstone
